ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Everything from the basics of Chinese language.
This course is extremely effective at teaching Chinese. It was a lot of work, but this really paid off in the amount I learned.
I got a better understanding of basic Chinese.
I learned how to speak, read, and write in Chinese on a basic level.
I learned a good work ethic given that Chinese has a lot of work each day.

I gained so much knowledge in Chinese 110. I came in knowing limited Chinese and ended the class being able to have a full conversation, read a variety of characters, and much more. The class placed an emphasis on learning how to speak, so I became much more comfortable with that. I also learned how Chinese grammar structure works, learned a ton of vocabulary, and overall improved my reading and writing abilities, as well as my pronunciation.
I learned so much Chinese in what was actually a very short period of time.

I significantly improved my ability to speak, read, and write Chinese. This course required a lot of discipline in order to stay up to date with the vocabulary, grammar, etc. from each new lesson. I was glad to see how much I was able to improve my Chinese skills in such a short period of time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strenghts: Great professors, my professor was amazing at teaching our section. Everyone learned Chinese so well and so quickly. 
Weakness: heavy work load but that is natural with a language i guess.
Course is extremely rigorous. It requires to study a lot due to the pace of the classes. As a result, it serves a great introduction to  Chinese.

Li Laoshi was very good at involving every student in class. Each of us learned that we could say new things in Chinese daily. A substantial but manageable amount of daily homework reinforced what we'd studied in class. I was occasionally a little confused about the way assignments were graded on Canvas.
Strengthes were class is engaging, weakness is that it was too fast paced I think.
You learn a lot and it's engaging to be in a small, interactive classroom
I think there is a very good support structure - all the teachers and TAs want you to succeed and are willing to help.

I enjoy how small the class size is - it facilitates a very collaborative and engaging environment. I also like how we meet everyday, this really helps with speaking and getting familiar with the language. The class time of 50 minutes is also perfect. A weakness of the course is that we usually learn straight out of the textbook. I think it would be helpful to read about conversations out of the textbook or engage with some materials outside of it, but I understand there are time constraints.
There are so many strengths to the course but definitely the ones I benefited the most from were the small class size, the great professor, and the closeness of our class.

The strength of this course is that this course requires a lot of engagement, both in the classroom and outside. Although this can prove to be challenging and a bit nerve-wrecking, especially in the beginning when you have absolutely no knowledge of Chinese, it forces you to practice daily and really hone in on your strengths and weaknesses. The only weakness I would say is that the expectation of listening comprehension sometimes moved too fast. It was very easy to feel very behind. I think this could be improved by introducing more listening comprehension practice outside of the classroom that isn't just listening to the lessons' dialogues.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, to anyone who is interested in learning Chinese. You definitely will learn with this level of teaching, if you just put your own effort into it.
Yes, it is a very useful course
I would recommend this course to another student. If you are sincerely interested in learning Chinese, this course is the perfect place to start.
Yeah, I had a great teacher and you'll learn a ton.
Yes, if you want to learn Chinese this is obviously a great class
Yes. I would recommend it to anyone interested in Chinese because they will notice significant improvements in all aspects of their Chinese speaking ability.
I would recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning Chinese. You do not need any prior knowledge and you emerge from the class with greater understanding of the language.
I would recommend this course to another student. I learned so much and looked forward to classes.

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to someone who truly wishes to learn Chinese. If you only want to fulfill the language requirement and that's it, this might not be the course for you. I think this course is fit for anyone who is dedicated to actually learning Chinese.
